sbinet commented on pull request #3600: ARROW-4388 [Go] add DimNames() method to tensor Interface
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3600#discussion_r256398240
 
 

 ##########
 File path: go/arrow/tensor/tensor.go
 ##########
 @@ -104,6 +104,7 @@ func (tb *tensorBase) NumDims() int             { return len(tb.shape) }
 func (tb *tensorBase) DimName(i int) string     { return tb.names[i] }
 func (tb *tensorBase) DataType() arrow.DataType { return tb.dtype }
 func (tb *tensorBase) Data() *array.Data        { return tb.data }
+func (tb *tensorBase) DimNames() []string     { return tb.names }
 
 Review comment:
   please `gofmt` your code.
   it makes for nice, regular looking, code. (for some definition of "nice". thankfully, all gophers have _now_ the same definition. :P)
   
   a simple:
   ```
   $> cd github.com/apache/arrow/go
   $> gofmt -w .
   ```
   should do.
   
   it's a good idea to wire `gofmt` inside your favorite editor (or, even better, use [goimports](https://godoc.org/golang.org/x/tools/cmd/goimports) that does pretty much the same thing than `gofmt` but also adds/removes automatically package to/from the `import` block when used/unused.)
   see:
   - https://github.com/golang/go/wiki/IDEsAndTextEditorPlugins
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

anson627 commented on issue #3600: ARROW-4388 [Go] add DimNames() method to tensor Interface
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3600#issuecomment-463313514
 
 
   > apologies for the belated answer.
   > 
   > you only have added the `DimNames` method to the concrete type (`tensor.tensorBase`.)
   > you are missing the modification of the actual `tensor.Interface`.
   > 
   > could you please add it?
   > thanks.
   > 
   > that said, I must admit I am not completely sold on adding `DimNames`...
   > @stuartcarnie, @alexandreyc ? what's your take on this?
   
   Thanks for getting back to me! I just added it to the interface.
   
   Just to give you some context, I'm just trying to ramp up on the codebase, by picking up some high level starter task. What's the best way for me to get engaged and be able to contribute better?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

rcoreilly commented on issue #3600: ARROW-4388 [Go] add DimNames() method to tensor Interface
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3600#issuecomment-465884358
 
 
   yep DimNames() just makes it much easier to convert between arrow tensor and other implementations of tensor -- otherwise you would have to manually reconstruct the DimNames slice by iterating over the DimName method.  Not the biggest thing in the world but definitely seems worth including given how trivial it is to do so.  And adding it consistently to the interface as well as the impl makes sense.  Thanks!
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

Not the biggest thing in the world but definitely seems worth including given how trivial it is to do so. And adding it consistently to the interface as well as the impl makes sense. Thanks!
